00006 /* AUTORIGHTS

00012 
00013 #include "generic.h"
00014 #include "mathop.h"
00015 #include "rodrigues.h"
00016 
00017 #include <math.h>
00018 
00025 VL_EXPORT
00026 void 
00027 vl_rodrigues(double* R_pt, double* dR_pt, const double* om_pt)
00028 {
00029   /*
00030     Let
00031      
00032        th = |om|,  r=w/th,  
00033        sth=sin(th),  cth=cos(th), 
00034        ^om = hat(om)
00035 
00036     Then the rodrigues formula is an expansion of the exponential
00037     function:
00038      
00039      rodrigues(om) = exp ^om = I + ^r sth + ^r^2 (1 - cth).
00040 
00041     The derivative can be computed by elementary means and
00042     results:
00043 
00044     d(vec rodrigues(om))    sth  d ^r    1 - cth  d (^r)^2
00045     -------------------- =  ---- ----- + -------  -------- +
00046           d om^T             th  d r^T     th      d r^T
00047                   
00048                           sth                     1 - cth
00049           + vec^r (cth - -----) + vec^r^2 (sth - 2-------)r^T
00050                           th                         th
00051   */
00052 
00053 #define OM(i)   om_pt[(i)]
00054 #define R(i,j)  R_pt[(i)+3*(j)]
00055 #define DR(i,j) dR_pt[(i)+9*(j)]
00056 
00057   const double small = 1e-6 ;
00058 
00059   double th = sqrt( OM(0)*OM(0) + 
00060                     OM(1)*OM(1) +
00061                     OM(2)*OM(2) ) ;
00062   
00063   if( th < small ) {
00064     R(0,0) = 1.0 ; R(0,1) = 0.0 ; R(0,2) = 0.0 ;
00065     R(1,0) = 0.0 ; R(1,1) = 1.0 ; R(1,2) = 0.0 ;
00066     R(2,0) = 0.0 ; R(2,1) = 0.0 ; R(2,2) = 1.0 ;
00067     
00068     if(dR_pt) {
00069       DR(0,0) = 0  ; DR(0,1) = 0   ; DR(0,2) = 0 ;
00070       DR(1,0) = 0  ; DR(1,1) = 0   ; DR(1,2) = 1 ;
00071       DR(2,0) = 0  ; DR(2,1) = -1  ; DR(2,2) = 0 ;
00072 
00073       DR(3,0) = 0  ; DR(3,1) = 0   ; DR(3,2) = -1 ;
00074       DR(4,0) = 0  ; DR(4,1) = 0   ; DR(4,2) = 0 ;
00075       DR(5,0) = 1  ; DR(5,1) = 0   ; DR(5,2) = 0 ;
00076 
00077       DR(6,0) = 0  ; DR(6,1) = 1   ; DR(6,2) = 0 ;
00078       DR(7,0) = -1 ; DR(7,1) = 0   ; DR(7,2) = 0 ;
00079       DR(8,0) = 0  ; DR(8,1) = 0   ; DR(8,2) = 0 ;
00080     }
00081     return ;
00082   }
00083 
00084   {
00085     double x = OM(0) / th ;
00086     double y = OM(1) / th ;
00087     double z = OM(2) / th ;
00088     
00089     double xx = x*x ;
00090     double xy = x*y ;
00091     double xz = x*z ;
00092     double yy = y*y ;
00093     double yz = y*z ;
00094     double zz = z*z ;
00095     
00096     const double yx = xy ;
00097     const double zx = xz ;
00098     const double zy = yz ;
00099     
00100     double sth  = sin(th) ;
00101     double cth  = cos(th) ;
00102     double mcth = 1.0 - cth ; 
00103     
00104     R(0,0) = 1          - mcth * (yy+zz) ;
00105     R(1,0) =     sth*z  + mcth * xy ;
00106     R(2,0) =   - sth*y  + mcth * xz ;
00107     
00108     R(0,1) =   - sth*z  + mcth * yx ;
00109     R(1,1) = 1          - mcth * (zz+xx) ;
00110     R(2,1) =     sth*x  + mcth * yz ;
00111     
00112     R(0,2) =     sth*y  + mcth * xz ;
00113     R(1,2) =   - sth*x  + mcth * yz ;
00114     R(2,2) = 1          - mcth * (xx+yy) ;
00115     
00116     if(dR_pt) {
00117       double a =  sth / th ;
00118       double b = mcth / th ;
00119       double c = cth - a ;
00120       double d = sth - 2*b ;
00121       
00122       DR(0,0) =                         - d * (yy+zz) * x ;
00123       DR(1,0) =        b*y   + c * zx   + d * xy      * x ;
00124       DR(2,0) =        b*z   - c * yx   + d * xz      * x ;
00125       
00126       DR(3,0) =        b*y   - c * zx   + d * xy      * x ;
00127       DR(4,0) =     -2*b*x              - d * (zz+xx) * x ;
00128       DR(5,0) =  a           + c * xx   + d * yz      * x ;
00129       
00130       DR(6,0) =        b*z   + c * yx   + d * zx      * x ;
00131       DR(7,0) = -a           - c * xx   + d * zy      * x ;
00132       DR(8,0) =     -2*b*x              - d * (yy+xx) * x ;
00133       
00134       DR(0,1) =     -2*b*y              - d * (yy+zz) * y ;
00135       DR(1,1) =        b*x   + c * zy   + d * xy      * y ;
00136       DR(2,1) = -a           - c * yy   + d * xz      * y ;
00137       
00138       DR(3,1) =        b*x   - c * zy   + d * xy      * y ;
00139       DR(4,1) =                         - d * (zz+xx) * y ;
00140       DR(5,1) =        b*z   + c * xy   + d * yz      * y ;
00141       
00142       DR(6,1) = a            + c * yy   + d * zx      * y ;
00143       DR(7,1) =        b*z   - c * xy   + d * zy      * y ;
00144       DR(8,1) =     -2*b*y              - d * (yy+xx) * y ;
00145       
00146       DR(0,2) =     -2*b*z              - d * (yy+zz) * z ;
00147       DR(1,2) =  a           + c * zz   + d * xy      * z ;
00148       DR(2,2) =        b*x   - c * yz   + d * xz      * z ;
00149       
00150       DR(3,2) =  -a          - c * zz   + d * xy      * z ;
00151       DR(4,2) =     -2*b*z              - d * (zz+xx) * z ;
00152       DR(5,2) =        b*y   + c * xz   + d * yz      * z ;
00153       
00154       DR(6,2) =        b*x   + c * yz   + d * zx      * z ;
00155       DR(7,2) =        b*y   - c * xz   + d * zy      * z ;
00156       DR(8,2) =                         - d * (yy+xx) * z ;
00157     }
00158   }
00159 
00160 #undef OM
00161 #undef R
00162 #undef DR
00163 
00164 }
00165 
00178 VL_EXPORT
00179 void vl_irodrigues(double* om_pt, double* dom_pt, const double* R_pt)
00180 {
00181   /*
00182                     tr R - 1          1    [ R32 - R23 ]
00183       th = cos^{-1} --------,  r =  ------ [ R13 - R31 ], w = th r.
00184                         2           2 sth  [ R12 - R21 ]
00185      
00186       sth = sin(th)
00187      
00188        dw    th*cth-sth      dw     th   [di3 dj2 - di2 dj3]
00189       ---- = ---------- r,  ---- = ----- [di1 dj3 - di3 dj1].
00190       dRii     2 sth^2      dRij   2 sth [di1 dj2 - di2 dj1]
00191      
00192       trace(A) < -1 only for small num. errors.
00193   */
00194 
00195 #define OM(i)    om_pt[(i)]
00196 #define DOM(i,j) dom_pt[(i)+3*(j)]
00197 #define R(i,j)   R_pt[(i)+3*(j)]
00198 #define W(i,j)   W_pt[(i)+3*(j)]
00199 
00200   const double small = 1e-6 ;
00201 
00202   double th = acos
00203     (0.5*(VL_MAX(R(0,0)+R(1,1)+R(2,2),-1.0) - 1.0)) ;
00204   
00205   double sth = sin(th) ;
00206   double cth = cos(th) ;
00207 
00208   if(fabs(sth) < small && cth < 0) {
00209     /*
00210       we have this singularity when the rotation  is about pi (or -pi)
00211       we use the fact that in this case
00212 
00213       hat( sqrt(1-cth) * r )^2 = W = (0.5*(R+R') - eye(3)) 
00214       
00215       which gives
00216 
00217       (1-cth) rx^2 = 0.5 * (W(1,1)-W(2,2)-W(3,3))
00218       (1-cth) ry^2 = 0.5 * (W(2,2)-W(3,3)-W(1,1)) 
00219       (1-cth) rz^2 = 0.5 * (W(3,3)-W(1,1)-W(2,2)) 
00220     */
00221     
00222     double W_pt [9], x, y, z ;
00223     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(0,0) + R(0,0) ) - 1.0 ;    
00224     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(1,0) + R(0,1) ) ;
00225     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(2,0) + R(0,2) );
00226     
00227     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(0,1) + R(1,0) );
00228     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(1,1) + R(1,1) ) - 1.0;
00229     W_pt[0] = 0.5*( R(2,1) + R(1,2) );
00230   
00231     W_pt[0] =  0.5*( R(0,2) + R(2,0) ) ;
00232     W_pt[0] =  0.5*( R(1,2) + R(2,1) ) ;
00233     W_pt[0] =  0.5*( R(2,2) + R(2,2) ) - 1.0 ;
00234 
00235     /* these are only absolute values */
00236     x = sqrt( 0.5 * (W(0,0)-W(1,1)-W(2,2)) ) ;
00237     y = sqrt( 0.5 * (W(1,1)-W(2,2)-W(0,0)) ) ;
00238     z = sqrt( 0.5 * (W(2,2)-W(0,0)-W(1,1)) ) ;
00239     
00240     /* set the biggest component to + and use the element of the
00241     ** matrix W to determine the sign of the other components
00242     ** then the solution is either (x,y,z) or its opposite */
00243     if( x >= y && x >= z ) {
00244       y = (W(1,0) >=0) ? y : -y ;
00245       z = (W(2,0) >=0) ? z : -z ;      
00246     } else if( y >= x && y >= z ) {
00247       z = (W(2,1) >=0) ? z : -z ;
00248       x = (W(1,0) >=0) ? x : -x ;
00249     } else {
00250       x = (W(2,0) >=0) ? x : -x ;
00251       y = (W(2,1) >=0) ? y : -y ;
00252     }
00253 
00254     /* we are left to chose between (x,y,z) and (-x,-y,-z)
00255     ** unfortunately we cannot (as the rotation is too close to pi) and
00256     ** we just keep what we have. */
00257     {
00258       double scale = th / sqrt( 1 - cth ) ; 
00259       OM(0) = scale * x ;
00260       OM(1) = scale * y ;
00261       OM(2) = scale * z ;
00262       
00263       if( dom_pt ) {
00264         int k ;
00265         for(k=0; k<3*9; ++k)
00266           dom_pt [k] = VL_NAN_D ;
00267       }
00268       return ;
00269     }
00270 
00271   } else {
00272     double a = (fabs(sth) < small) ? 1 : th/sin(th) ;
00273     double b ;
00274     OM(0) = 0.5*a*(R(2,1) - R(1,2)) ;
00275     OM(1) = 0.5*a*(R(0,2) - R(2,0)) ;
00276     OM(2) = 0.5*a*(R(1,0) - R(0,1)) ;
00277     
00278     if( dom_pt ) {
00279       if( fabs(sth) < small ) {
00280         a = 0.5 ;
00281         b = 0 ;
00282       } else {
00283         a = th/(2*sth) ;
00284         b = (th*cth - sth)/(2*sth*sth)/th ;
00285       }
00286 
00287       DOM(0,0) = b*OM(0) ;
00288       DOM(1,0) = b*OM(1) ;
00289       DOM(2,0) = b*OM(2) ;
00290         
00291       DOM(0,1) = 0 ;
00292       DOM(1,1) = 0 ;
00293       DOM(2,1) = a ;
00294 
00295       DOM(0,2) = 0 ;
00296       DOM(1,2) = -a ;
00297       DOM(2,2) = 0 ;
00298 
00299       DOM(0,3) = 0 ;
00300       DOM(1,3) = 0 ;
00301       DOM(2,3) = -a ;
00302       
00303       DOM(0,4) = b*OM(0) ;
00304       DOM(1,4) = b*OM(1) ;
00305       DOM(2,4) = b*OM(2) ;
00306         
00307       DOM(0,5) = a ;
00308       DOM(1,5) = 0 ;
00309       DOM(2,5) = 0 ;
00310 
00311       DOM(0,6) = 0 ;
00312       DOM(1,6) = a ;
00313       DOM(2,6) = 0 ;
00314 
00315       DOM(0,7) = -a ;
00316       DOM(1,7) = 0 ;
00317       DOM(2,7) = 0 ;
00318 
00319       DOM(0,8) = b*OM(0) ;
00320       DOM(1,8) = b*OM(1) ;
00321       DOM(2,8) = b*OM(2) ;
00322     }
00323   }
00324 
00325 #undef OM
00326 #undef DOM
00327 #undef R
00328 #undef W
00329 }
